title: Video path does not point to a file -- Extracting frames needs to point to an existing video

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
**Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):**

- Windows 10Pro 
- DeepLabCut-2.2rc3 through anaconda
- DeepLabCut mode: multi-animal tracking

**To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior, i.e.:**

- Created a new project and added new videos successfully 
- deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,mode='automatic',algo='kmeans',userfeedback=False,crop=True)

**Error code:**
```python
Config file read successfully.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-22-3dca5034b1c2> in <module>
----> 1 deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,mode='automatic',algo='kmeans',userfeedback=False,crop=True)

~\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\frame_extraction.py in extract_frames(config, mode, algo, crop, userfeedback, cluster_step, cluster_resizewidth, cluster_color, opencv, slider_width, config3d, extracted_cam)
    236
    237                 if opencv:
--> 238                     cap = VideoReader(video)
    239                     nframes = len(cap)
    240                 else:

~\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\auxfun_videos.py in __init__(self, video_path)
     20     def __init__(self, video_path):
     21         if not os.path.isfile(video_path):
---> 22             raise ValueError(f'Video path "{video_path}" does not point to a file.')
     23         self.video_path = video_path
     24         self.video = cv2.VideoCapture(video_path)

ValueError: Video path "C:\Users\PhysiozooTest\NOR-SAhmed-2021-07-13\videos\STM_CS-9L_CS-9R_CS-9N_F.mp4" does not point to a file.
```
